item.title: 空中客车公司在历史性机库交换中建造新的 A320neo 装配线
item.description: 空中客车公司已开始在图卢兹建造一条新的 A320neo 系列飞机组装线，以取代效率较低的旧设备，并帮助从明年起加快生产速度。【原文：Airbus has started building a new A320neo-family assembly line in Toulouse to replace an older and less efficient facility and help speed up production from next year.】

item.title: 欧洲央行决策者警告通胀挑战
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）决策者周五警告说，将通胀率降至2%的最后阶段可能会特别艰难，但他们表示有信心政策正在按照预期发挥作用，有些决策者甚至认为2024年还有进一步放宽政策的空间。【原文：European Central Bank policymakers warned on Friday that the final stage of pushing inflation down to 2% could be especially hard but said they were confident that policy was working as intended, while some even saw room to ease policy further in 2024.】

item.title: 咆哮的凯蒂猫》计划重返 YouTube，GameStop 大涨
item.description: GameStop 的股价在周五的盘前交易中飙升了 30% 以上，原因是投资者为 "Roaring Kitty "在 YouTube 上的回归做好了准备。"Roaring Kitty "是一位股票影响者，她最近在社交媒体上发布的帖子引发了所谓的 "备忘录 "类股票的上涨。【原文：GameStop's shares surged more than 30% in premarket trading on Friday as investors geared up for the YouTube return of "Roaring Kitty", the stock influencer whose recent social media posts have sparked a rally in so-called meme stocks.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：美国议员呼吁将中国 CATL 和 Gotion 列入禁止进口名单
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，一群共和党议员称，中国电池公司 CATL 和 Gotion High Tech 应立即被列入禁止进口名单，他们指控这两家公司的供应链使用强迫劳动。【原文：Chinese battery companies CATL and Gotion High Tech should be added immediately to an import ban list, a group of Republican lawmakers said, alleging their supply chains use forced labor, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 银行称人工智能日益依赖大科技会带来新风险
item.description: 欧洲银行业高管表示，人工智能的蓬勃发展将增加银行对美国大型科技公司的依赖，给银行业带来新的风险。【原文：The boom in artificial intelligence will increase banks' dependence on big U.S. tech firms, creating new risks for the industry, European banking executives said.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称德国正考虑增购八架 F-35 喷气式战斗机
item.description: 一位军方消息人士周五告诉路透社记者，德国正在考虑在已订购的35架F-35战斗机基础上，再购买8架美国国防巨头洛克希德-马丁公司生产的F-35战斗机。【原文：Germany is looking into buying eight additional F-35 fighter jets made by U.S. defence giant Lockheed Martin , a military source told Reuters on Friday, on top of the 35 jets it has ordered.】

item.title: 由于资本支出升级，日本第一季度国内生产总值降幅将小于首次报告：路透调查
item.description: 路透社周五的一项民意调查显示，由于资本支出数据的上调，1-3月份日本经济的收缩速度可能略低于最初报告的速度，尽管风险继续给前景蒙上阴影。【原文：The Japanese economy likely contracted at a slightly slower pace than initially reported in January-March due to upgrades to capital spending figures, a Reuters poll showed on Friday, although risks continue to cloud the outlook.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯将在阿美石油公司股票发行中筹资 112 亿美元，定价在区间下限
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周五告诉路透社，沙特阿拉伯准备从石油巨头阿美石油公司（Aramco）股票的二次发行中筹集超过 112 亿美元的资金，此前定价为 27.25 里亚尔（7.27 美元），接近价格区间的下限。【原文：Saudi Arabia is poised to raise more than $11.2 billion from its secondary offering of oil giant Aramco's shares, after pricing them towards the lower end of a price range at 27.25 riyals ($7.27), people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 美国人越来越挑剔，但仍在热销商品上消费
item.description: 投资者正在研究美国的信用卡消费模式，以确定哪些趋势（如果有的话）会在夏季给专业零售商带来推动力。【原文：Investors are scouring U.S. credit card spending patterns to size up which, if any, trends could give specialty retailers a boost in the summer months.】

item.title: 美国 5 月就业增长有望保持温和步伐
item.description: 美国 5 月份的就业增长可能保持温和步伐，工资涨幅预计也将保持稳定，这将使美联储在利率问题上保持观望状态，但很可能会鼓励人们押注该央行今年至少会降低一次借贷成本。【原文：U.S. job growth likely maintained its moderate pace in May and wage gains were expected to hold steady, which would keep the Federal Reserve in wait-and-see mode on interest rates but likely encourage bets the central bank will lower borrowing costs at least once this year.】

item.title: 股票投资者发掘欧洲降息赢家
item.description: 在欧洲中央银行（ECB）近五年来首次降息后，欧洲股票投资者正加紧寻找可能从借贷成本下降中受益的股票。【原文：Investors in European equities are stepping up their search for stocks that are likely to benefit from lower borrowing costs, after the European Central Bank's (ECB) first interest-rate cut in almost five years.】

item.title: 早间竞价全球风险反弹取决于薪资水平
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 中国 5 月出口增速高于预期，推动经济复苏
item.description: 5 月份，中国出口连续第二个月实现快速增长，这表明工厂业主正在设法寻找海外买家，为经济在长期的房地产危机中努力实现持久复苏提供了一些缓解。【原文：China's exports grew more quickly and for a second month in May, suggesting factory owners are managing to find buyers overseas and providing some relief to the economy as it battles to mount a durable recovery amid a protracted property crisis.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，日本 MUFG 和 SMFG 将出售超过 85 亿美元的丰田股票
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引消息人士的话报道，三菱日联金融集团和三井住友金融集团正在考虑出售价值 1.32 万亿日元（85 亿美元）的丰田汽车战略股份。【原文：Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group and Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group are considering selling 1.32 trillion yen ($8.5 billion) worth of strategic shareholdings in Toyota Motor , Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing sources.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将因降息反弹而实现周线上涨
item.description: 在主要央行本周启动宽松利率周期后，亚洲股市周五将结束两周连跌，这也增加了人们对美国联邦储备委员会可能很快跟进的预期。【原文：Asian stocks are set to snap a two-week losing streak on Friday after major central banks kick-started their rate easing cycle this week, adding to expectations the U.S. Federal Reserve could soon follow suit.】

item.title: 美元徘徊在八周低点附近，非农测试迫在眉睫
item.description: 周五，在一份至关重要的美国就业报告公布之前，美元徘徊在八周低点附近，该报告将为美联储的降息时机提供线索。【原文：The dollar hovered close to an eight-week low on Friday, ahead of a crucial U.S. jobs report that should provide clues on the timing of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 欧佩克+安抚市场，欧洲央行降息，油价攀升
item.description: 在欧佩克+成员国沙特阿拉伯和俄罗斯表示准备暂停或撤销产量协议，以及欧洲降息引发美国采取类似行动的前景之后，周五油价继续攀升。【原文：Oil prices rose on Friday, continuing to climb after OPEC+ members Saudi Arabia and Russia indicated readiness to pause or reverse output agreements and as an interest rate cut in Europe raised the prospect of a similar U.S. move.】

item.title: Netflix 面临 1.7 亿美元的 "驯鹿宝宝 "诽谤诉讼
item.description: 周四，Netflix 被一名苏格兰妇女起诉，索赔至少 1.7 亿美元，该妇女称自己在热播迷你剧《驯鹿宝宝》中被描绘成跟踪狂，因而遭到诽谤。【原文：Netflix was sued on Thursday for at least $170 million by a Scottish woman who said she was defamed over her portrayal as a stalker in the hit mini-series "Baby Reindeer."】

item.title: 穆迪发现保险公司未来几年将增加私人信贷风险
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）的最新报告显示，全球保险公司计划在未来几年进一步投资于不断增长但不透明的私人信贷市场。【原文：Global insurers plan to invest further in the coming years in the growing but opaque private credit market, according to a new report by Moody's Ratings.】

item.title: 三星电子工会将于周五举行首次罢工
item.description: 韩国三星电子的一个工会将于本周五举行该科技巨头的首次罢工，但一些分析师预计，有关薪酬和条件的劳工行动不会对芯片生产产生重大影响。【原文：A Samsung Electronics union in South Korea is due to stage on Friday the first walkout at the technology giant, but some analysts did not expect the labour action over pay and conditions to have a major impact on chip production.】

item.title: 沃尔玛将在 2,300 家门店用数字价格屏取代纸质货架标签
item.description: 沃尔玛数千家门店将取消纸质货架价格标签。【原文：Paper shelf price labels are going away at thousands of Walmart stores.】

item.title: 空中客车公司五月份交付量下降 16
item.description: 空中客车公司（Airbus）周四表示，5月份交付了53架飞机，比去年同期下降了16%，使自1月1日以来交付给客户的飞机数量达到256架。【原文：Airbus delivered 53 aircraft in May, down 16% from the same month last year and bringing the number of airplanes handed over to customers since Jan. 1 to 256, the planemaker said on Thursday.】

item.title: Netflix 披露与 Skydance 合作动画片的新细节
item.description: Netflix 周四分享了即将上映的动画电影《咒怨》和《普库》的新细节，这两部电影是与 Skydance Animation 合作制作的。【原文：Netflix on Thursday shared new details about upcoming animated films “Spellbound” and “Pookoo,” which were made in partnership with Skydance Animation.】

item.title: 早间新闻印度利率决议为疯狂一周画上句号
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 彭博社称赫兹考虑出售 7 亿美元担保债务及可转换债券
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，租车公司赫兹正在考虑出售至少 7 亿美元的担保债务和发行可转换票据，以巩固其资产负债表。【原文：Rental car firm Hertz is weighing a sale of at least $700 million in secured debt and a convertible notes offering, as it looks to shore up its balance sheet, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: S3 Partners称，针对英伟达的空头押注高达340亿美元
item.description: 在英伟达（Nvidia）有可能取代微软成为全球最有价值公司之际，至少有一些投资者押注其飙升的股价将重返地球。【原文：As Nvidia threatens to dethrone Microsoft as the world's most valuable company, at least a few investors are betting its soaring shares will return to earth.】

item.title: Emerson 将以 35 亿美元的交易向 Blackstone 出售谷轮合资公司的剩余权益
item.description: 工程解决方案公司 Emerson 周四表示，已同意将其在谷轮合资企业中的剩余权益出售给 Blackstone，交易价值约为 35 亿美元。【原文：Engineering solutions firm Emerson said on Thursday it had agreed to sell its remaining interest in its Copeland joint venture to Blackstone in a deal valued at about $3.5 billion.】

item.title: 华尔街对国库集中清算的时间表忧心忡忡
item.description: 在华尔街面临 2026 年最后期限之际，证券业和金融市场协会可能会要求监管机构给予更多时间来实施一项要求集中国债清算的规则。【原文：The Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association may ask regulators for more time to implement a rule requiring centralized Treasury clearing as Wall Street faces a 2026 deadline.】

item.title: 英国科技先驱迈克-林奇在美国欺诈案审判中被判无罪释放
item.description: 周四，旧金山的一个陪审团宣布 Autonomy 创始人迈克-林奇（Mike Lynch）欺诈罪名不成立，这对这位自 2011 年以 110 亿美元将公司出售给惠普公司（HP）的灾难性交易以来一直饱受法律问题困扰的企业家来说是一个重大胜利。【原文：Autonomy founder Mike Lynch was acquitted of fraud on Thursday by a jury in San Francisco, a major win for the entrepreneur who has been dogged by legal problems since the disastrous sale of his company to Hewlett-Packard (HP) for $11 billion in 2011.】

item.title: 消息人士称，New Era Cap 将收购生活方式品牌 47
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周四表示，美国主要体育联盟头饰供应商 New Era Cap 已同意收购体育生活方式品牌 '47'。【原文：New Era Cap, a supplier of major U.S. sports league headware, has agreed to acquire sports lifestyle brand '47, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】
